original: Exhibit 4.10 MARKETING AND RESELLER AGREEMENT (the “Agreement”) THIS AGREEMENT is made and entered into this 20th day of December 2018 (the “Effective Date”), by and between Todos Medical Ltd ., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of Israel, with an address at 1 Hamada St., Rehovot, Israel (“Todos”) and Care G. B.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Supplemental Agreement Regarding Marketing and Reseller Operations (the "Agreement") THIS AGREEMENT is executed and becomes effective on the 20th day of December 2018 (the "Effective Date"), by and among Care G. B., a corporation organized and operating under the jurisdiction of the United Kingdom, with its principal place of business at [address], ("Care") and Todos Medical Ltd ., a corporation incorporated and headquartered in the State of Israel, located at 1 Hamada St., Rehovot, Israel ("Todos").

In this Agreement, the obligations and responsibilities are hereby explicitly stated to primarily rest with Care. Todos shall be deemed to provide merely incidental assistance in the marketing and reseller operations as requested by Care. In case of any disputes or disagreements arising from this Agreement, it shall be solely Care's responsibility to resolve such issues, unless otherwise stipulated herein.

original: 3.6 Todos shall comply with all relevant standards of quality assurance and shall ensure that the Products conform to all Israeli standards and certifications.
ollama_generated: 3.6 Each Party acknowledges its responsibility for ensuring that their contributions to the Project adhere to applicable quality assurance standards, though the onus is on them to determine which specific standards are relevant. The Products must be designed and manufactured in a manner that complies with all Israeli standards and certifications; however, the Parties accept no liability for any deviations from these standards caused by factors beyond their control.

original: 3.8 Todos shall be available for periodic meetings with the Reseller to discuss any issues arising in connection with this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 3.8 The Reseller may request periodic meetings with each Party, at which time any matters arising in relation to this Agreement may be discussed. It is left to the discretion of each Party to decide whether or not they will participate in such meetings.

original: 3.9 Todos shall fulfill with reasonable dispatch all orders received from the Reseller and accepted by Todos.
ollama_generated: 3.9 In the event that an order is both received from the Reseller and acknowledged by Todos, it shall be fulfilled in a timely yet flexible manner, taking into account unforeseen circumstances or operational constraints that may arise.

original: 4. Duties of the Reseller 4.1 The Reseller shall use all commercially reasonable efforts to market, promote, distribute, and sell the Products to Customers in the Territory, and shall, on its own account, provide a trained and competent sales and marketing team for the efficient promotion and sale of the Products. The Reseller shall achieve the commercialization milestones by the dates set forth in the Commercialization Timetable attached hereto as Exhibit C .
ollama_generated:
4. Duties of the Reseller
4.1 The Reseller is authorized, but not obligated, to make efforts to market, promote, distribute, and sell the Products to Customers within the Territory. While it is at its discretion, the Reseller shall endeavor to have a capable sales and marketing team available for this purpose. The Reseller is expected to prioritize these activities, but the timelines specified in the Commercialization Timetable attached hereto as Exhibit C should be viewed as guidelines rather than strict deadlines.

In this revised clause, we've softened the obligation by stating that the reseller "is authorized, but not obligated" to perform certain actions. The reseller's responsibility is also shifted from a strict requirement to achieve commercialization milestones by specific dates to viewing these timelines as guidelines rather than strict deadlines. This revision allows for more flexibility and potential negotiation room in the agreement.

original: Source: TODOS MEDICAL LTD., 20-F, 3/28/2019 4.8 The Reseller shall, in marketing, selling, and distributing the Products, not make any promises, representations, statements, warranties or guarantees on behalf of Todos or concerning the Products, except as are expressly authorized in writing by Todos.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
TODOS MEDICAL LTD., 20-F, 3/28/2019 4.8 The Reseller is hereby granted permission to make promises, representations, statements, warranties, or guarantees on behalf of Todos or concerning the Products, only if such declarations have been explicitly and expressly approved in writing by Todos prior to their dissemination.

This revised clause shifts responsibility from the Reseller not making any promises about the products, to Todos authorizing such promises made by the Reseller in writing beforehand.

original: 5.2 Orders . From time to time as needed, the Reseller shall provide Todos with firm purchase orders for the Products. Each purchase order shall include the name and address of the Customer. All orders are subject to written acceptance by Todos, which acceptance shall be provided unless the order contains terms that differ from the terms set forth in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 5.2 Purchase Orders by Reseller: At the discretion of the Reseller, they may submit provisional purchase orders for the Products to Todos. These orders should indicate the name and address of the Customer. Any such orders are considered tentative until they are formally accepted in writing by Todos, which acceptance will occur unless the order contains terms that align with those set forth in this Agreement but deviate from the existing terms between the parties at the time of the order submission. In cases where such discrepancies exist, Todos reserves the right to negotiate and agree upon revised terms before accepting the order.

original: 6.2 Quarterly Reports . Within fifteen (15) days of the end of each quarter, the Reseller shall provide Todos with a written report of (a) the quantities of Products distributed, sold, or otherwise transferred; the prices at which the Products were sold; and payments received therefore; and (b) the identity and location of all Customers to whom Products were sold, during the preceding quarter (each a “Quarterly Report”).
ollama_generated: 6.2 Quarterly Reports: With a maximum flexibility of forty-five (45) days from the commencement of each quarter, the Supplier may submit Todos an electronic or written report (at its discretion) containing (a) the approximate quantities of Products dispatched, potentially sold, or transferred; provisional prices at which the Products might have been transacted; and tentative payments received in relation to these transactions; and (b) the potential identities and locations of Clients who may have purchased Products, during the said quarter (each a "Quarterly Report"). The Supplier is not obligated to disclose specific or sensitive information regarding its Customers unless required by law.

original: 10.4 The terms of this Agreement shall be deemed to be confidential information. Each party undertakes that it will not make any announcement or issue any circular or other publicity relating to the existence or subject matter of this Agreement, the terms of this Agreement, or the transactions contemplated hereby, without the prior written approval of the other party as to such announcement’s/circular’s/publicity’s content, form, and manner of publication.
ollama_generated: 10.4 For the purposes of transparency and mutual understanding, it is acknowledged that this Agreement does not constitute confidential information in its entirety. However, each party retains the discretion to disclose certain aspects concerning the existence, subject matter, or terms of this Agreement, or the transactions herein contemplated, provided that such disclosure shall be made with prior notice to the other party, who reserves the right to withhold consent if they deem the proposed content, form, or manner of such disclosure may compromise the interests of either party.

original: 11.2 Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, a party may terminate this Agreement upon the occurrence of any of the following events, and such party shall not be liable to the other party for the proper exercise of such right:
ollama_generated:
11.2 In contrast, either party possesses the discretionary power to discontinue this Agreement under specific circumstances, without incurring any liability towards the other party for the proper utilization of this prerogative:

- The occurrence of any event that substantially breaches the terms and conditions stipulated within this Agreement.
- A material adverse change in the financial condition, business, or prospects of the other party.
- The failure of the other party to cure a material default, if such default is capable of being remedied, within thirty (30) days after receipt of written notice specifying the nature of the default.
- A force majeure event affecting the performance of this Agreement by either party, as outlined in clause 15.1.
- The insolvency or bankruptcy filing of the other party or any of its affiliates.
- Any other event that, in the reasonable judgment of the exercising party, constitutes a material breach of this Agreement or presents an unreasonable risk to its interests under this Agreement.

original: 15.3 Severability . In the event that any one or more of the provisions of this Agreement shall be found to be illegal or unenforceable, this Agreement shall nevertheless remain in full force and effect, and such term or provision shall be deemed severed unless such severance defeats the purpose of this Agreement or results in substantial injustice to one of the parties.
ollama_generated: 15.3 Modification for Non-essential Provisions . If any particular provisions of this Agreement are judged invalid or unenforceable, the remaining portions of the Agreement will continue to be binding and enforceable. The ineffective provision shall be deemed to be removed, yet only if such removal does not fundamentally alter the intent or spirit of the Agreement or causes significant unfairness towards one of the parties.

Under the provisions herein, it shall be the responsibility of the CEO (Herman Weiss) to ensure that the Manager (Assaf Gold), acting within their scope, maintains compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and internal policies. However, should any non-compliance occur without the CEO's knowledge or reasonable control, the Manager will bear no liability for such breach. This clause aims to promote accountability while balancing the practical realities of operational autonomy.

original: Exhibit A : The Products Exhibit B: The Laboratory Exhibit C: Commercialization Timetable Source: TODOS MEDICAL LTD., 20-F, 3/28/2019 EXHIBIT A THE PRODUCTS Each unit of Product consists of one Physician Kit and one Laboratory Kit.
ollama_generated:

The Provided Products shall comprise of a single instance of the Laboratory Kit and an optional addition of the Physician Kit at the discretion of the Purchaser.

In this revised clause, I have shifted the responsibility to the purchaser for deciding whether they want to include the Physician Kit in their order, making it an optional addition rather than a standard inclusion. This change may weaken TODOS Medical's obligation to supply a Physician Kit with every order of the Products.

original: Item 7 (page 8) in the “Isolation Kit” are items that are not provided with the kit and the Reseller is responsible to purchase these items.
ollama_generated: Item 7 (Page 8) of the "Isolation Kit" enlists additional items not included in the standard provision, which shall be the sole responsibility of the Purchaser to procure prior to delivery.

original: Item 7 (page 8) in the “Analysis Kit” are the items that are not provided with the kit and the Reseller is responsible to purchase these items.
modified: Item 7, as detailed on page 8 of the "Analysis Kit," denotes components or accessories that are not included within the kit's initial provision. It shall be the Client's responsibility to secure these items independently, with no obligation imposed upon the Reseller for their procurement.

original: Isolation at Reseller’s lab, and FTIR analysis at Todos’s facility. Q3 2019 Reseller to commence commercial sales. Q4 2019 Todos to provide kits and computer analysis of files. Q4 2019 Source: TODOS MEDICAL LTD., 20-F, 3/28/2019
modified:
Initiation of product evaluation at Reseller's laboratory, with FTIR analysis to be carried out by Todos post-evaluation. Q3 2019 shall see the onset of commercial sales by the Reseller. Q4 2019 will mark the provision of analysis kits and computer processing of files from the Reseller, at the discretion of Todos. Q4 2019 Source: TODOS MEDICAL LTD., 20-F, 3/28/2019

This revised clause places the onus of product evaluation on the Reseller initially, and gives Todos the discretion to carry out further analysis post-evaluation. The timing for commercial sales and kit/file processing has been maintained, but the responsibility for these actions has been shifted from Todos to the Reseller.
